title: Tomato Basil Concassé
ingredients: 2 large, vine-ripe tomatoes, seeded and chopped
⅓ cup finely chopped fresh basil leaves
instructions: In a bowl combine well the tomatoes, the oil, the vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste then stir in the basil.  Cover and chill the concassé for up to 2 hours before serving.  Give it a final toss at serving time.
remarks: I would imagine that one could cut down the acidity of the concassé, and possibly change the character of the dish, if balsamic vinegar were used instead of red-wine vinegar.
yield: Makes about 2½ cups, adequate for up to 4 persons.
source: Cuisine Courante:  A Luncheon in Bermuda, Gourmet Magazine, May 1991.
